summary: This document is a brief internal note or email from a staff member (likely a corrections officer or counselor) describing a visit with inmate Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on Thursday, August 8, 2019. The staff member reports on Epstein's mental state, requests, and planned meeting with his attorneys, noting no signs of depression, anxiety, or suicidal ideation. This document is significant as it provides a snapshot of Epstein's condition and activities two days before his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate visited in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). He was preparing to meet with his attorneys, made various requests, and denied any suicidal thoughts or mental health concerns.

events.title: SHU Visit with Epstein
events.description: A staff member visited inmate Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Epstein was preparing to meet with his attorneys, had a cell mate, made various requests (e.g., social calls without speaker phone, retrieval of a book), and denied any suicidal thoughts or mental health concerns.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) as of August 8, 2019.
Epstein had a cell mate at the time of the visit and was observed interacting with them.
Epstein explicitly denied any suicidal thoughts or intentions and showed no signs of depression or anxiety during the visit.
Epstein was actively preparing to meet with his attorneys to work on his legal situation.
The document is dated August 10, 2019, and describes a visit that occurred on the prior Thursday (August 8, 2019), two days before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
